claim.text: Trump's FBI reportedly spent nearly $1 million on a 'special redaction project' for Jeffrey Epstein files when their release was anticipated.

post_content.heading: FBI Redaction Project Cost for Epstein Files Unsubstantiated
post_content.body: The claim asserts that "Trump's FBI" spent nearly $1 million on a "special redaction project" for Jeffrey Epstein files when their release was anticipated. While it is true that Epstein files were released and some mentioned Trump (as confirmed by the provided sources), neither article offers any evidence to support the specific claim of the FBI spending nearly $1 million on a *special redaction project*. One source discusses a White House briefing on newly released Epstein emails referencing Trump, and the other notes the Attorney General alerted Trump about his name appearing in the files. These sources confirm the existence of the files and Trump's references but provide no details on FBI spending or specific redaction project costs. Therefore, the financial and project-specific aspects of this claim are unsubstantiated.
post_content.summary: While Epstein files mentioning Trump were released, the claim of the FBI spending $1 million on a specific redaction project remains unsubstantiated by the provided sources.

misinformation_sources.title: Trump's FBI reportedly spent nearly $1 million on a 'special redaction project' for Jeffrey Epstein files when their release was anticipated.

original_verification.claim_text: Trump's FBI reportedly spent nearly $1 million on a 'special redaction project' for Jeffrey Epstein files when their release was anticipated.

verification.message: While sources confirm that Jeffrey Epstein files have been released and contain references to Donald Trump (Source 1 and 2), none of the provided sources mention the FBI spending nearly $1 million on a 'special redaction project' for these files.
verification.reasoning: 1. Source 1 states that newly released Epstein documents 'reference Trump.' 2. Source 2 states that 'Attorney General Pam Bondi informed President Trump... that his name appeared in the Jeffrey Epstein files.' Both sources confirm the connection between Trump and the Epstein files. However, neither source, nor Source 3 (which is about the FBI searching John Bolton's home), mentions the FBI spending nearly $1 million on a 'special redaction project' related to these files.

original_verification.content_summary: The Reddit title claims that Trump's FBI allocated nearly $1 million to a "special redaction project" in anticipation of the release of Jeffrey Epstein files. However, the provided linked and scraped content focuses entirely on a different legal case: a lawsuit by Perlmutter against the Trump admini
